content.webTitle: The Slits show the way after punk

fields.headline: The Slits show the way after punk
fields.bodyText: By the time the Slits (above), a rare all-woman band, recorded their debut, they had outgrown the bulldozing clatter of their earlier Peel sessions for something altogether more intriguing. Produced by Dennis Bovell, Cut cooked up a restless, offbeat art-pop from fractured guitar, ever-shifting rhythms and the joyful polyglot patois of singer Ari Up, all itchy energy and fizzing with invention. Return of the Giant Slits (1981) stepped deeper into dub; Cut, meanwhile, still sounds unlike anything else, despite the countless followers it has inspired since.
